item.description:
Hi Everyone,

The weather looks --OK-- enough for this simple hike and a nice Buff-A afterward should also be good

 

This is a simple hike along a picturesque trail witch has had a Historical Past from our modern times back to Native Americans Shelters.

As with all events, this is supposed to be an enjoyable time hiking and socializing and is best with good weather conditions. I will update and make changes if necessary prior to the event.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nurse Ratchet says:

Getting to the Insane Hike Spot:

GPS ----APX #395 Reservoir Road, Middletown,ct

 

http://www.bing.com/maps/?FORM=MLOMAP&PUBL=GOOGLE&CREA=userid1743gobroadfphumem2khvlw7ml8dkb3h3kcgsoxz1369#JnE9LjM5NSUyYnJlc2Vydm9pciUyYnJvYWQlMjUyYyUyYm1pZGRsZXRvd24lMjUyY2N0JTdlc3N0LjAlN2VwZy4x...==

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

After the hike its Buff-A style Indian food.

*We went here after Barbara's Hike and i thought it was pretty good for a change (no pot luck), yes seating is at a long table but it was OK. and its very close to the Hike Site.

The crew is  ready to eat the Insane Portions of food with their bare hands:

1 Driving Directions from the reservoir :; WEST on Reservoir Road, then Left onto Bartholomew Road, At Tommy's Pizza take a RIGHT on Route 155 West (Randolph Road). After 2.5 miles (approx) turn left at light on Route 17 South. Proceed about .3 miles and restaurant is on left hand side.

http://www.haveliindia.com/

 

See some of you HERE.

al-r

item.name: Group Hike @ Insane Asylum's Cut in Half Brain Reservoir Trail & Indian Buff-A
